title: Alain Delon, enduring star of French cinema, has died
summary: The embodiment of the actor par excellence and a personality as much as an artist, Alain Delon lived his art with an unparalled intensity. He died at the age of 88.

title: Death of Alain Delon: The muted ambivalence of the man and the actor
summary: Cop and thug, grace and violence, progressive acts and reactionary ideology, throughout his career and life, the actor, who died at the age of 88, walked a tightrope.

title: Italy salutes Alain Delon as an actor who is also part of its history
summary: The tributes came in quickly in Italy on Sunday following the announcement of the death of the actor known for 'The Leopard,' 'L'Eclisse,' 'Rocco and His Brothers' and 'La prima notte di quiete,' all filmed with Italian directors.

title: Death of Alain Delon: 'Some people buy cars, but I prefer paintings'
summary: Between film shoots, the actor, who has died at age 88, visited museums and expanded his collections, which included paintings, sculptures and drawings.

title: Optimistic once again, the Democratic Party prepares to celebrate the advent of Kamala Harris
summary: The Democratic National Convention, which opens in Chicago on August 19, will offer the vice president an opportunity to consolidate the momentum she has generated in record time since Joe Biden's withdrawal from the US presidential race.

title: India: the rape and murder of a doctor shocks the country
summary: As protests spread across the country, the opposition denounced the authorities's 'indulgence' of violence against women, forcing Prime Minister Narendra Modi to break his silence.

title: The world of fans according to Clémentine Schneidermann: 'I had no idea of the incredible phenomenon Aya Nakamura represents'
summary: Beyoncé, Taylor Swift or Aya Nakamura's groupies don't mind waiting for hours on the sidewalk or spending a long time getting ready to try to look like the artists they admire. Photographer Clémentine Schneidermann captured them in pictures.

title: Mbappé and Madrid denied in Mallorca draw
summary: The French superstar was thwarted by Mallorca goalkeeper Dominik Greif and after Rodrygo Goes sent Madrid ahead early on, the hosts leveled in the second half through Vedat Muriqi's towering header.

title: Immigration: In Spain, the fate of unaccompanied minors fuels tensions
summary: The autonomous regions of the peninsula are reluctant to take in the 'menas' arriving in large numbers from Africa to the Canary Islands and immigration has now become a contentious issue.

title: Ukrainian forces claim to hold many Russian soldiers captured in the Kursk region
summary: Moscow has reportedly contacted Kyiv to initiate talks about a prisoner exchange. Eleven days after the start of its offensive on Russian territory, Ukraine continues to apply pressure on the Kremlin.

title: Tran To Nga's lifelong fight against Agent Orange
summary: This French-Vietnamese woman fights for victims of the highly toxic herbicide. On August 22, the Paris Court of Appeal will rule on the liability of 14 American petrochemical giants for the millions of Agent Orange-caused deaths during the Vietnam War.

title: Five French coastal gardens to visit this summer
summary: Gardens along the Atlantic and Mediterranean coasts often feature exotic plants that thrive in the local climate. Thanks to plentiful spring rains, they are a joy to stroll through during the summer season.

title: Haiti's justice system powerless to deal with gangs
summary: Inadequately funded, Haiti's courts have been operating at a snail's pace since armed gangs destroyed the Port-au-Prince courthouse. The government is seeking to relaunch the penal reform plan to combat the prevailing impunity in the country.

title: Trump hurls fresh insults at 'lunatic' Harris as she gains popularity in the polls
summary: Republicans and Trump advisers – concerned by Harris's energized campaign – have publicly urged him to stick to the issues and lay off the personal attacks, but the former president has shown no sign of changing his populist, confrontational style.

title: The left is being tested by the Venezuelan crisis
summary: In Latin America, a division between democracies and authoritarian regimes seems to have replaced the traditional left-right divide after Nicolas Maduro's self-proclaimed victory in the presidential election.

title: Wildfires engulf French town outside of Montpellier, with evacuations ongoing
summary: A total of 600 firefighters, 11 water bombers and two helicopters have been deployed to contain the blaze in Frontignan, local civil security authorities said on X. Responders are struggling to predict the direction of the fire due to strong winds.

title: Billie Eilish held a concert at the beach. Does anyone care?
summary: During the Paris Olympic Games' closing ceremony, Tom Cruise was tasked with transferring the torch to California where several American stars, including Billie Eilish, were waiting on the beach.

title: Niewiadoma wins Women's Tour de France by just four seconds
summary: The Polish cyclist won her first women's Tour de France as she dug in during the race's grueling final Alpine ascent.

title: Kamala Harris touches down in Chicago for the Democratic National Convention
summary: The US vice president, who will give Thursday's headline speech after replacing President Joe Biden as the party's nominee, stepped off Air Force Two with her husband Doug Emhoff after a day of campaigning in Pennsylvania.

title: In Moscow, the fear of a new military call-up: 'Our borders are not being protected.'
summary: The war that has erupted on Russian soil in the Kursk region is arousing mixed feelings among men of fighting age. Meanwhile, bounties for signing up 'for the front' are reaching record sums.

title: 'Napoleon Bonaparte was attracted by the figure of Muhammad and the centrality of the Quran in Islam'
summary: Although he never considered converting, Napoleon was quick to see the political value of Islam. 'The Napoleonic code was in a way Bonaparte's Quran!' said historian Ahmed Youssef in an interview with 'Le Monde,' analyzing the impact of the French expedition to Egypt, both for the country and for the future emperor.

title: Bilbao, Spain's Guggenheim Museum is reinvigorating the region's economy
summary: The economic impact generated since the museum opened in 1996 is estimated at €7.7 billion. This museum contributes 10 times more to the Basque treasury than the public funds it receives.

title: The Dassault family, a succession of ill feelings
summary: Successions, season 3 (1/6). This is the story of a family where fathers are hard on their sons, to the point of contempt, whether in private life or in the management of the media-military-industrial group, created by Marcel Dassault in 1929, and a third generation consumed by dissension.

title: Why do French political parties keep changing names?
summary: Certain parties often change their name in response to crises or difficulties, or to broaden their horizons. It's 'an injunction to reinvent oneself,' according to political scientist Rémi Lefebvre.

title: Nancy Huston, writer: 'I'd rather kill myself than go to an old people's home, but I realize that's the attitude of a healthy person'
summary: The Canadian writer maintains that 'women are less afraid of death than men' and that she has never been happier than she is today, at 70.

title: Why Macron is (still) in no hurry to name a prime minister
summary: The appointment of a new prime minister will take place next week, after Emmanuel Macron consults with party leaders this Thursday. The president is taking his time to push back the specter of his imminent disappearance.

title: 'French monument': Film world and politicians pay tribute to Alain Delon
summary: The actor's death on Sunday, August 18, at the age of 88 prompted a wave of reactions, from Emmanuel Macron to Brigitte Bardot.

title: Southern France wildfires force thousands to evacuate
summary: Two blazes in southern France that forced the evacuation of thousands and destroyed hundreds of hectares have been brought under control.

title: Alain Delon's death: Film star hailed across the globe, from Japan to US
summary: Around the world, the press is filled with superlatives about the impact of the late French actor's films.

title: Palestinian militants claim Tel Aviv bombing, threaten more attacks
summary: Hamas and Islamic Jihad said they were responsible for a 'suicide operation' that injured one person, according to Israeli police.

title: Protests widen over Indian doctor's rape and murder
summary: Doctors in government-run hospitals went on strike across the country, while rival football fans marched together in support.

title: French left torn after Mélenchon threatens procedure to remove Macron from office
summary: On Sunday, the Socialists, Greens and Communists distanced themselves from the 'solemn warning' issued to President Macron by La France Insoumise leader Jean-Luc Mélenchon, fearing the threat scuttles the left's chances of governing.

title: Thierry Henry steps down as coach of France's U21s
summary: The former international, who took the job in the summer of 2023, took this decision for 'personal reasons,' said the French Football Federation. A few days ago, he won silver with the Olympic squad.

title: For the Leclercs, only the name is inherited
summary: 'Successions,' season 3 (2/6). Edouard Leclerc, founder of the Leclerc cooperative that became a global retailer, had planned to choose his successor among its members, but his son Michel-Edouard stepped into the shoes. At 72, 'France's favorite CEO' is in no hurry to hand over the reins to his own successor.

title: Fear among Birmingham's Muslims after racist riots
summary: In the UK's second-largest city, home to its largest Muslim community outside London, the fear is palpable and the city's mosques have issued advice to their faithful, including not to pay attention to rumors.

title: Michel Guérard, chef who was last living legend of 'nouvelle cuisine,' has died
summary: A three-Michelin-star chef since 1977 at the hotel-restaurant Les Prés d'Eugénie, combining slimming cuisine with gourmandise, Guérard died on Sunday at age 91.
